item.title: IN WHICH I Stump for Vi
item.description:
At the mundane little sysadmin blog I contribute to, I wrote a little piece explaining why you need to know vi keybindings.

I’m sure you emacsheads will love it.

item.title: Announcing ihopesolution.com
item.description:
So a sysadmin friend and I decided that there just weren’t enough blogs about systems administration and linux out there. So we started another one:

ihopesolution.com

I’m sure it will develop its own voice, since we both have, um, firmly held opinions about how things should be done. And odd senses of humor.

Since I tend to use emacs more for writing and org-mode rather than sysadminning, I’ll keep my emacs posts for my personal blog. (And so ends my feeble attempt to justify tagging this “emacs” and watching it hit planet emacsen.)

item.title: My Thoughts Exactly re: Singularity
item.description: I’ve been meaning to write this exact post on the singularity. Apparently I no longer have to. Thanks, lazyweb!

item.title: If You Read, You Should Read “A Reader’s Manifesto”
item.description:
This essay on reading is captioned by the editor “An attack on the growing pretentiousness of American literary prose”. And boy howdy!

[https://www.theatlantic.com/doc/200107/myers](https://www.theatlantic.com/doc/2 00107/myers)

I highly recommend it for anyone who reads fiction at all whatsoever.
